clinical_study.brief_title: Training of Orthopedic Residents in OP Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Management of Patients With Osteoporotic Fractures by Orthopedics Residents: an Observational Cross-sectional Study

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective: To assess whether residents (R1, R2 or R3 according to the year of residency) of an orthopedic tertiary service, investigate, treat and / or refer the patient with an osteoporotic fracture to treat osteoporosis (OP) and whether this learning is improved over the years of residence.
Methods: Residents answered diagnostic and therapeutic questions related to a clinical case of osteoporotic fracture (OF) in 4 scenarios, which were the initial care in the emergency room, at the time of discharge from hospital, during their outpatient return in 3 and 6 months. Answers were compared between years of residence.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month
primary_outcome.description: Number of residents investigating and treating osteoporosis in an appropriate manner

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient referral to secondary prevention of osteoporotic fracture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Number of residents that does not start osteoporosis treatment but refer the patient to another professional to conduct the case.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change the proficiency of secondary prevention with increasing graduation in the residency program
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Increase the number of residents who adequately treat osteoporosis categorized by year of graduation

arm_group.description: Resident of the first year of orthopedics and traumatology at IOT-HC-FMUSP.
Resident of the second year of orthopedics and traumatology at IOT-HC-FMUSP.
Resident of the third year of orthopedics and traumatology at IOT-HC-FMUSP.

intervention.description: After signing the informed consent form agreeing to participate in the study, the participants answered the questionnaire about diagnostic and therapeutic questions related to a clinical case of osteoporotic fracture in 4 scenarios: the initial care in the emergency room, at the time of discharge from hospital, during their outpatient return in 3 and 6 months.

study_pop.textblock: Physicians enrolled in the medical residency program in orthopedics and traumatology at IOT-HC-FMUSP.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Physicians enrolled in the medical residency program in orthopedics and traumatology at IOT-HC-FMUSP.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Abandonment of the medical residency program in orthopedics and traumatology at IOT-HC-FMUSP.
- Withdrawal from the medical residency program in orthopedics and traumatology at the IOT-HC-FMUSP for a period of more than 120 days.
- Expulsion from the medical residency program in orthopedics and traumatology at IOT-HC-FMUSP.
- Transfer of the medical residency program in orthopedics and traumatology from IOT-HC-FMUSP to another institution.
